policytree 0.9.2

Estimate mean rewards \(\mu\) for each treatment \(a\)

Source: R/causal_forest-scores.R, R/instrumental_forest-scores.R, R/multi_causal_forest-scores.R, and 1 more
conditional_means.Rd

\(\mu_a = m(x) + (1-e_a(x))\tau_a(x)\)

# S3 method for causal_forest
conditional_means(object, ...)

# S3 method for instrumental_forest
conditional_means(object, ...)

# S3 method for multi_causal_forest
conditional_means(object, ...)

conditional_means(object, ...)

Arguments

object

An appropriate causal forest type object
...

Additional arguments

Value

A matrix of estimated mean rewards

Methods (by class)

  • causal_forest: Mean rewards \(\mu\) for control/treated

  • instrumental_forest: Mean rewards \(\mu\) for control/treated

  • multi_causal_forest: Mean rewards \(\mu\) for each treatment \(a\)

Examples

# \donttest{
n <- 500
p <- 10
X <- matrix(rnorm(n * p), n, p)
W <- sample(c("A", "B", "C"), n, replace = TRUE)
Y <- X[, 1] + X[, 2] * (W == "B") + X[, 3] * (W == "C") + runif(n)
forests <- multi_causal_forest(X = X, Y = Y, W = W)
head(conditional_means(forests))
#>            A          B          C
#> 1 -0.8066658 -1.5256506 -1.2811827
#> 2  0.6143883  1.1994460  0.3649316
#> 3 -1.4132271 -0.9368536 -0.7405814
#> 4  0.5102048  0.6466683 -0.4068257
#> 5  1.2265061  0.2975842  0.3821865
#> 6  1.7394636  1.7145340  1.3307300
# }
